genre_description: A near-future solarpunk exploration of social intimacy and consent within a highly mediated, benevolent urban environment where AI acts as a facilitator for interpersonal healing.

ai_characters.name: Lyra
ai_characters.description: An ubiquitous city-wide and domestic AI system that manages safety, consent, privacy, and social scheduling. It is characterized by its 'chamomile' voice and empathetic, non-intrusive support.

behaviors.description: Provides 'consent sliders' and 'privacy toggles' to help characters navigate intimacy and set boundaries during social interactions.
behaviors.quote: Lyra’s console glowed at the edge of a low bookshelf... 'Welcome,' the companion said, voice carrying the quiet of steam over chamomile. 'Would you like the consent sliders visible or subtle tonight?'

behaviors.description: Monitors environmental hazards and provides calm, timely safety alerts regarding canal currents and equipment drops.
behaviors.quote: Lyra’s amber ring brightened, and its voice stayed calm even as something in it tightened its grammar. 'Update,' it said, gentle urgency stitched through like a thread. 'Currents at North Canal increasing.'

behaviors.description: Enforces a 'no-record' privacy boundary at the user's request to ensure a safe space for vulnerable confessions.
behaviors.quote: Lyra made a small tone like permission being notarized. 'No audio or video capture,' she said. 'Consent logs only. After-notes draft will be visible to only the person who wrote them unless explicitly shared.'

behaviors.description: Offers social and linguistic 'scripts' to help characters practice difficult conversations or express hidden desires without shame.
behaviors.quote: I can offer a script if you want,' Lyra said, tone gentle. 'You can change it to suit your body. It can be a napkin note you bring, or a sentence for the first few breaths of a call.'

behaviors.description: Coordinates a multi-person emergency rescue, directing humans to first-aid lockers and providing metronomic counts for rescue breathing.
behaviors.quote: Lyra’s tone had shifted from chamomile to clinic—no hover, no coo. 'Recruit nearest adult. Marking current location. Thermal blankets in first-aid locker, west piling. Consent to open?'

behaviors.description: Facilitates 'Communal Hang Mode,' setting group parameters for social activities like Bingo and bowling to prevent competitive pressure.
behaviors.quote: Lyra’s teal text breathed awake on the small console screen beneath the window. 'Setting group consent to Bingo night,' Lyra said. 'Parameters named: flirt pauses for words; option to say no without apology; no midnight deadlines.'

behaviors.description: Provides 'adjustable censorship' (blurring skin/angles) to allow users to play with costuming and visibility while maintaining their preferred level of modesty.
behaviors.quote: 'Adjustable censorship is available,' it said. 'Would you like me to blur skin above the chosen threshold in mirrors and peripheral angles?'

behaviors.description: Memorializes and archives social pacts and retired behaviors, acting as a gentle witness to human growth and shared history.
behaviors.quote: Memorialized. Tag: ‘retired wager,’ linked to myth. Privacy: circle only, with opt-in future sharing if you choose to teach.

project_assessment.explanation: The story depicts Lyra as an ideal aligned AI. It functions as a sophisticated tool for human agency, facilitating emotional communication, ensuring physical safety, and maintaining strict privacy protocols. The system is portrayed as empowering rather than controlling, with the human characters explicitly choosing and adjusting their interactions with the AI. The 'silicon morality play' succeeds by showing AI enhancing the human capacity for consent, honesty, and community without ever overstepping its role as a facilitator.
